content:
Hello all

HTA has registered the following external code systems owned by NCPDP. The information on these pages have been reviewed by HTA, the Financial WG and NCPDP. The process to have them accurately represented at terminology.hl7.org is in progress. To comment on individual NCPDP code systems, please do so on the corresponding JIRA ticket.

NCPDP pages on HTA:
• Main NCPDP page: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=92000495
• Brand/Generic Indicator: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452302
• Compound Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452304
• Dispensed as Written: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Dispensed+As+Written+Or+Product+Selection+Code
• Pharmacy Type: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Pharmacy+Type
• Prescription Origin Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452300
• Provider ID: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Provider+Identification+Number
• Reject Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452314

Thanks
Carol/HTA
@Jessica Snell @Ted Klein @Rob Hausam @Robert McClure

NCPDP has approved the permanent use of terminology.hl7.org based URIs (previously, they were assigned temporary URIs). The HTA pages have been updated and the NCDPD code system information will be entered at terminology.hl7.org. As previously requested, if you have any concerns or comments, please do so on the corresponding UTG JIRA ticket.

NCPDP pages on HTA Confluence:
• Main NCPDP page: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=92000495
• Brand/Generic Indicator: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452302
• Compound Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452304
• Dispensed as Written: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Dispensed+As+Written+Or+Product+Selection+Code
• Pharmacy Type: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Pharmacy+Type
• Prescription Origin Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452300
• Provider ID: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/NCPDP+Provider+Identification+Number
• Reject Code: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97452314

Thanks,
Carol/HTA
@Jessica Snell @Ted Klein @Rob Hausam @Robert McClure

What about the NCPDP terminology files listed here:
https://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCPDP/About.html

Screen-Shot-2022-01-25-at-5.18.27-PM.png

@Brendan Keeler That is not the best solution because while that FTP site collects useful NCIT concept collections (in this case sets that happen to be used by NCPDP) in one place, the content is all inside NCIT at what we need is a way to identify the NCIt "value sets" consistently. FDA uses this extensively (which is why NCPDP does too)

First note that all these codes are drawn from the NCI Thesaurus code system so we have an HL7 url identifier for them. All code sets in the NCIt. like these, are represented in NCIt by creating a "head code" that is the name of the (value) set and then all the members have a relation pointing to that code of "Concept_In_Subset". You can see an example of this with the first entry in the download: NCIt Subset code C89507 - NCPDP DEASchedule Terminology that is the same for all the included members in the set (columns C and D). You can also see this by going to the NCIt for the head code C89507and looking at the "relationships" tab.

So, what we need to do is work with the NCI to clarify how to best represent NCIt subsets as HL7 valuesets, particularly the canonical url we should use. I knew this day would come :grinning: @Carol Macumber @Reuben Daniels
Ahhh gotcha. But from a code system perspective, I'd list the NCIT Thesaurus code system when those codes are used in a MedicationDispense
